alert.note: Alert for Van Buren (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Tornado Warning issued September 18 at 7:42PM CDT until September 18 at 8:00PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 800 PM CDT FOR SOUTHERN VAN BUREN COUNTY... At 741 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located over Lake Sugema Campground, or near Keosauqua, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Tornado and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. This dangerous storm will be near... Lake Sugema Campground around 745 PM CDT. Keosauqua, Lacey Keosauqua State Park, Keosauqua Airport and Van Buren County Fairgrounds around 750 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this tornadic thunderstorm include Mount Sterling and Bentonsport/Vernon. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
